Ozone Knockout ’08
Ozone Knockout ’08

Office of Air Quality staff will be traveling around the state urging Hoosier citizens and businesses to reduce activities which contribute to the creation of ground-level ozone—and rewarding those who do. Special educational events are being held across the state.

Indiana’s Electronic Waste Management Rules
Indiana’s Electronic Waste
Management Rules

Background and General Info
Background and General Info

• Developed to minimize confusion with current solid and hazardous waste rules regarding recycling of electronic wastes.
• Developed to minimize confusion with current
solid and hazardous waste rules regarding
recycling of electronic wastes.

• Directed at facilities that are storing or processing
• Directed at facilities that are storing or processing

(dismantling, deconstructing, recycling, etc.) electronic wastes.
(dismantling, deconstructing, recycling, etc.)
electronic wastes.

• Mostly removes e-waste from solid and
• Mostly removes e-waste from solid and

hazardous waste regulation if reused or recycled.
hazardous waste regulation if reused or recycled.

• Imposes minimum standards for generators to
• Imposes minimum standards for generators to

manage their e-waste.
manage their e-waste.

Generators, 329 IAC 16-3-1(7)
Generators, 329 IAC 16-3-1(7)

• Exempted from registration requirements if requirements regarding e-waste intended for recycling are met: – Storage and transportation can’t cause
• Exempted from registration requirements if
requirements regarding e-waste intended
for recycling are met:
– Storage and transportation can’t cause

contamination (specific standards to meet)
contamination (specific standards to meet)

– No speculative accumulation – Containers must be labeled – Disposal must be in accordance with solid
– No speculative accumulation
– Containers must be labeled
– Disposal must be in accordance with solid

and hazardous waste regulations
and hazardous waste regulations

Other exclusions
Other exclusions

• Less than 23 tons onsite, with enclosed storage • E-waste brokers • Short term collection (<5 day removal to
• Less than 23 tons onsite, with enclosed storage
• E-waste brokers

registered facility)
registered facility)

• Refurbished/resale only

• Recycling operations with incidental amounts of

facilities
facilities

e-wastes
e-wastes

• All other facilities must register

Registration Highlights 329 IAC 16-5
Registration Highlights
329 IAC 16-5

• 5 year cycle once registration is obtained • Application is 'who, what and where' e-
• 5 year cycle once registration is obtained
• Application is 'who, what and where' e-

waste recycling is to be done
waste recycling is to be done

• Must provide detailed description of
• Must provide detailed description of

processes involved in e-waste recycling • Must submit emergency contingency plan • Must submit financial assurance
processes involved in e-waste recycling
• Must submit emergency contingency plan
• Must submit financial assurance

• Thermal or chemical treatment requires solid

waste processing facility permit (16-4)
waste processing facility permit (16-4)

• Storage standards, including labeling, record-

keeping, and no speculative accumulation (16-6)
keeping, and no speculative accumulation (16-6)

• Operational requirements, including building
signage and contingency planning (16-7)

• Employee training standards (16-8)

waste regulations (16-9)

• Closure and financial assurance requirements

million in loans and grants to a total of 28 Indiana businesses since 2005.
million in loans and grants to
